column4: too bad ArrenLex isn't here, i wanted to tell him that it works, but timidity doesn't have 100% support for MIDI, but it does have partial support for MIDI
can anyone tell me how to open a .bin file?
you usually don't open a .bin file, you execute it.
that's what i'm wanting to do, execute it
in linux you need to include the path, as linux doesn't handle execution quite like M$. Assuming you are in the same directory as the .bin, just type ./<filename>
from anywhere else, include the entire path (/home/me/filename)
thanks
i can't get the command to work
do a ls -l and see if the file is marked as executable. Know how to do that?
i'll try
the output of 'ls -l', on the left end, will have something like '-rwxrwxrwx', you need the x's
i run the command, here is the result: ken@Linux0001:~/Desktop$ ls -l /home/ken/Desktop/GoogleEarthLinux.bin
right....then you need the x's. 'chmod 755 /home/ken/Desktop/GoogleEarthLinux.bin'
and dr-nix: i ran the command(s), nothing happened
do the ls -l again and make sure the file is Now executable
ok
here is the result: ken@Linux0001:~/Desktop$ ls -l /home/ken/Desktop/GoogleEarthLinux.bin
/home/ken/Desktop/GoogleEarthLinux.bin is in green
then /home/ken/Desktop/GoogleEarthLinux.bin should run the file
do you get any output (error indication) when you run that command in a terminal?
it's working, thanks a lot
good. good luck
